creditline: On Loan from the Santa Barbara Museum of Art, Gift of Allen Gerdau
description: tall slender figure with round headress and protruding mouth; stands with squared shoulders and bow legged stance; hands are placed on either side of stomach; square metal base
text: This figure is displayed among musical instruments because, surprisingly, it is one. Adorned with armlets, a hat, and an amulet around the neck, it was traditionally carried in funeral processions for important elders and either rocked to the rhythm of accompanying instruments or pounded on the ground to create its own rhythm. Even its overall posture has a kind of rhythm and dynamism.
title: Male figure
